summary: This document is an email chain from May 2019 between federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York, requesting and receiving approval for travel to Florida to conduct victim interviews in the United States v. Epstein case. It references the case as an investigation relating to the enticement of minors for sexual activity.

connections.description: Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys working together on the Epstein investigation, coordinating travel for victim interviews.

events.title: Travel Approval Request for Florida Interviews
events.description: Prosecutors request approval to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days to conduct meetings and interviews with victims in the Epstein case.

events.title: Previous Travel Approval Request
events.description: A prior travel approval request was made for the same case (United States v. Epstein) to travel to West Palm Beach for victim interviews.

events.title: Initial Travel Approval Request
events.description: The earliest referenced travel request for the Epstein investigation, for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

keyFacts: The document confirms active federal investigation (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618) into enticement of minors for sexual activity was ongoing in May 2019.
Prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were traveling to Florida to conduct in-person interviews with victims.
The email chain shows coordination and approval processes within the U.S. Attorney's office for investigative travel.
The case reference (2018R01618) indicates the investigation was initiated in or before 2018.
